review: The Dragon A93 is a very decent unit for a the price. Charge it via the power adaptor the first few times! (I didn't because I don't read instruction, and it took forever!) It was a strange start to our relationship. Buttons for the home / return indicated on the manual do not exist on the product. I managed to lose the on screen controls and couldn't do anything with it. Rebooted then realized they are controlled by software and have not had an issue. The A33 Cortex A7 is a newish processor at a low cost. I didn't benchmark it just did some testing in real world use. Wifi reception isn't the greatest if your wifi is sketchy but works fine when you have a strong connection (I guess close to the router). The internal memory isn't great so you will have to do some workarounds when you are loading things on (an inherent android problem - not specific to this tablet) Minor stuff out of the way everything else is pretty good. Nice standard screen - touch response is good - and it zips around pretty well. It has a nice tactile case built into the area around the back of the unit which I like and in general its a good basic utility tablet. Mini SD if you want to expand memory but keep in mind android limitations. It will only play basic games. Asphalt 8 and Batman crashed on start up or 20 secs into the game when graphics options were set to the lowest. Even Zenonia 4 which has been out for ages crashed after ten mins play unless you went and set the graphics to low. It more for Angry Birds etc and ones that don't rely to much on the power of the machine. The OSD can be weird too - When playing Madden it would take several attempts to press something onscreen before it worked, yet it you bought up the OSD it would work straight away. I narrowed this down to the OSD not adjusting correctly so make sure you launch the games / programs with the OSD off then everything should perform as expected although it misaligns the buttons when you re launch it isn't a big deal if it is displaying right when it is launched. Dragon stuff is pretty good for what it is - been there seen it and this is a good budget option with more powerful feature filled options available if you want them in their other tablets. This one is a good utility tablet for the kids, as a backup music player, or for movies - does all of this OK just not good for games or intensive stuff. Can be a bit slow even with browsing with several things loaded but usually not to bad. I couldn't cover everything in the video but hopefully will give you an idea of the product in use. $75? OK with its limitations in mind. Product received for review opinions formed by me.

I really like shopping around in these under appreciated niche companies. I had never heard of Dragon Touch. I mean, everyone gets android, or ios, or amazon right? I was blown away by this guy. I'll get it's only con out of the way first: the screen resolution leaves something to be desired. It's good, but just a little pixely.

But I really don't care about screen resolution. I got this for reading books and scientific papers on and it's just perfect for that purpose. The wifi card in it is great. I mean, it's better than other wi fi devices / computers in my house.

The speed is great. This was something I was worried about, I mean, would it be responsive, and the answer is  a resounding yes. It's not laggy like I was expecting and it plays anything you'd expect to work on any other android devices.

One word of advice. At first, I thought the power cable didn't fit. It uses it's own custom power cable which is my only disappointment. You have to push the plug in just a little stronger than your used to. I didn't realize this until it's 5th charge or so, and previously I was annoyed that the plug wouldn't go in all the way, so it wouldn't deliver reliable power. I was wrong though, and you jsut have to push a little harder.

I would go buy one of these over the alternatives that can easily cost more than 5x. If you want a tablet, this is definitely the one and you won't be disappointed.

I bought this tablet knowing it wasn't expensive, would be clunky with the wi-fi and so forth like others have said.  I figured I could deal with that, and I was right.  There were a few aggravations but overall I'm not complaining my casual use of the web with it during travel.  But what I did NOT expect, and what was totally disappointed to find out, was how bad the sound card was!  The sound quality itself isn't bad I suppose, but the volume is extremely soft.  It has a volume limiter that posts a "nag screen" that you have to defeat, but even after that, when you set the volume as high as it will go, you will be able to hear it okay in a quiet place only.  When you get on say, an airplane, or in a noisy terminal for that matter, forget about it!  So with movies during flight I cannot hear the dialogue, and most music (except for some recordings that were evidently recorded louder) becomes unlistenable.  So that pretty much defeats most of the functionality I was interested in.  Oh, and the pictures that the camera takes are of quite poor definition.  In this day and age, you expect to have certain baseline functionality like adequate sound.  I consider that an underhanded move by the manufacturer to put in such a cruddy component.  Very disappointing.

Well people, you get what you pay for. I had low expectations for this tablet. They weren't low enough. I wanted to use these for a development project and thought I could use two of these for testing units. I needed some Android devices to do some user simulations and I didn't intend to use these for anything more than some simple diagnostic and analytic data generators. Wrong! So wrong! Sigh... The four star average rating on this product has to be a sham. I've had some budget devices before, they get pretty bad sometimes, and this product is bottom rung. Dust visible under the screen, the screen itself makes an awful screeching sound when you swipe your finger over it. It's that rubber/plastic rubbing sound that reminds you of window squeegee screeches at the car wash except in a really negative way. Oh, the digitizer was crooked and off kilter on both of the units I ordered. It's probably a painful representation about the sad life of the malnourished sweatshop worker who assembled the tablet, sad and drooping just enough to make you cringe a little on the inside. My first world issues! Why can't I just be happy with a handheld computer that connects to the whole world via the internet??? Because of my OCD, and because I deal with dozens of high tech products everyday and see the best and worst of them. Lord, why? ... Ok, back to the Dragon Touch A93.9. The screen is just bad all around. The 4.4.2 Android version seemed up to date, I'll give them that, but the user aesthetic experience was painful from the start. I didn't even get to sound quality. Bad screen and bad benchmarks is as far as I could stand before caring about the rest of the issues I knew I would find. Perhaps I am pretentious about electronics, but for a few more dollars, you can get a name brand Tablet performing, looking, and feeling much better. Don't waste your time. If you read this review you have lost too much of your life on this product already.

I purchased 3 of these tablets for my kids because the average reviews were over 4 stars so it seemed like a good value. The wifi on these tablets is very poor, and internet connection cuts off regularly such that I have to restart download of updates and new apps (this wastes a tremendous amount of time).  One of the tablets had very low volume relative to the other.  I installed Minecraft PE on all 3 tablets for my kids and eventually Minecraft PE would not launch on any of the 3 tablets.  Similarly, many other apps freeze on the tablets and/or are unable to download necessary updates or content. Camera photos are also terrible.  Overall, the poor operation of this tablet makes it not a feasible option for a budget tablet.  TabletExpress support has been useless, plagued by boilerplate responses that do not help the issues.  Fortunately, Amazon.com Customer Support has, as usual, come to the rescue!  Amazon has allowed me to return my 3 tablets after the regular return policy period expired, in light of these defects!  I look forward to returning these defective tablets, getting my refund from Amazon, and investing a bit more money in tablets manufactured by a more established, reputable brand.  This cheap Dragon Touch tablet simply is not worth the headache and wasted time in downloading apps and trying to fix issues.

I've never used a Dragon Touch tablet before, but have heard good things about them; and boy am I glad that I actually bought one for the low price of 55 dollars, free shipping and good quality.
Here's my review-

Build quality/accessories-

As usual, these days, you buy a tablet, you usually get the standard USB dongle, a charger, a manual and the Tablet itself; which is pretty much what I got in buying this. Some tablets offer a case, but I'm not picky.
Anyway, the build of this tablet is good. You'd be hard pressed to find a difference in build with this tablet when comparing it to most high end tablets out there. It has a little weight to it and feels sturdy, the capacitive screen is slick and has good quality. It comes in an all black color and buttons have the right amount of feel to them when you press them.

Score- 9.2/10

Specs/Gaming/Apps-

Being that this is a Google play enabled tablet, there's no need to root it. In fact, if Google play isn't your thing, you can always install the amazon app or 1 mobile market app as well for different apps altogether. As far as specs and gaming goes, gaming has been flawless and super responsive. You'd think with DDR3 ram in the tablet that it would be slightly slower than most, but apps are responsive. Of course, if you don't have a good Wi-Fi connection in your home, then the speed will go accordingly, but overall, the specs are handled really well. It works with all the standard apps like Skype, Google Play, GPS, Netflix, Hulu Plus, Youtube, etc. Start up time's about 20 seconds if that. It boots fast.

Score- 9.5/10

Screen/camera-
The screen is great. Very responsive and no lag that I can actually remember whatsoever. The camera on the other hand is just okay. It doesn't have the best quality, which is understandable as it's price warrants something to be off. Screen is multi-touch, yes, there's pinch and zoom.

Score- 8.5/10

Sound design, resolution, options-

The sound is good. It's nice and loud. Candy Crush sounds insanely loud for my taste and so do games like Wordament (which doesn't have music but sound effects). Screen resolution is crisp, there's a nice balance of contrast and richness in color detail.
Options include Wi-Fi, syncing google account, date and time, sound, alarm, notifications setup, language, display settings (smart color), about tablet, reset tablet, update, and many other adjustments. My only gripe is, tablets need to come with more exclusive apps (some came with Getjar, and even if Getjar sucks, it's still an exclusive app to some tablets, it would be nice to have a bonus sometimes, but I digress)

Overall-
For 50 plus dollars, this is absolute steal. It's fast, good build quality, good sound, cool interface, even comes on with a signature jingle. Google play. Worth every penny. I highly recommend this tablet.

I never bothered to try to get a warranty on it. I figured they'd just say it had been abused,and offer to "fix" it for me,for about 2/3 of what I paid for it new,plus shipping both ways. No thanks. I could probably just buy a new one cheaper. But I won't buy a new one. It's easier just to walk to the  bathroom,and flush my $70.00 down the toilet.

It had a decent screen resolution for e-reading,and watching Youtube vids,and movies,which is what I mostly used it for. It booted up fast,and had a quite responsive touch screen.it didn't freeze up,or spontaneously shut down,and it popped from website to website acceptably quickly. I cant address the issue of it being rooted from the factory,but anyone who thinks that any device you buy doesn't report back to Big Brother Inc. exactly what you're doing,is living with their head in the sand. Since I have become an Amazon customer, I think this would be my first negative review of any product. I don't give negative reviews for just for giving them, but this has been my experience with the product. The company as well as others may say different but my experience is just that, mines!
Pros:
So here goes. First of all my hats off to Amazon for providing great packaging, in a secure and safe delivery box. My products which includes a case for this tablet was delivered in record time and neatly packaged. When I unboxed the items, I definitely was impressed the tablet had a sort of leather back finish which was unique for a tablet, but I loved this sort of finish. All accessories were included with the tablet except for a headphones. This was minor since I always have lots of headphones which came with phones which I have bought previously so as I said this was minor.
Cons:
Here Is where my disappointment came as a mighty rushing wind. The item was bought as a gift for my wife who didn't want a costly brand name tablet but just a normal tablet that can surf the net lightly, check out facebook and twitter and maybe some skype. The tablet was very fast with its quad core processor apps launched at lightning speeds. But just as I was about to surf the net.....(Bonk!!)
The tablet could not recognize my router. I have other android phones, brand name (Samsung, Alcatel, HTC) and Chinese phones as well (maxwest) which connect to my nexxt stealth 150 router seamlessly and  without issue.
I tried rebooting my router which was working fine, nothing. I used the button at the back for secure connections, nothing. I rebooted the tablet, nothing. I tried downloading several other wifi connection apps, (via my pc) nothing. I even logged on to the tablet express website searching for help, any help that I can get, but the website was not very user friendly and did not provide any solutions whatsoever to this connection problem, they provided Only to download a whole lot of different roms which I have yet to try but this might void my warranty.
I even checked out there Youtube channel which also proved futile. I did get however more help from other people who had similar issues. Most of which were equally frustrated and just returned the item.
I tried with the best of my technical know how to try to get some sort of internet connectivity with this tablet and it was futile. My wife is disappointed, I am even more disappointed.
As I said all products bought from Amazon were of the highest standard thus far but this one was a lemon." A bricked tablet!"
Dont know if anything can be done as I live in Trinidad in the West Indies, but this has been my experience with this product.

The Dragon Touch tablet is a very good tablet for what it can do and for the price.  It is quite good for handling today's daily tasks and our multimedia consumption. My qualms with this device are: the fairly short battery life; WiFi is an energy hog, and it's very easy to forget it's still running; it sits on its speaker; you can't run the audio of YouTube like you can on a PC (just have it play in the background); lastly, it has a rather abysmal camera.  These issues are by no means a deal breaker, and some of its qualities can be improved upon with software updates.  I enjoy my tablet very much; it rivals my PC and other multimedia devices.  This is a worthy tablet in total.

Returning Tablet. Not happy with purchase. Listed below are my personal Pros/Cons for it.

*PROS*
1. Great sound, speaker is loud.
2. KitKat 4.4 is fast.

*CONS*
1. Charger gets extremely hot during charging, which I consider very unsafe and a fire hazard. Old fashion chargers should be banned in this day and age. A "SAFE" USB charger should be included for all tablets on the market, rather then a disaster waiting to happen.
****Do NOT leave unattended or plugged in when not in use****

2. Tablet has imbedded scuffs on screen. Almost look like finger prints but its not. I wonder if this is really a returned/refurbished tablet. I don't know, but that alone is reason enough to return it.

3. When unlocking tablet it automatically goes to Camera or Google search. This is very, very annoying.

4. Android theme music at startup is also very annoying and extremely loud. I've searched everywhere on tablet and can not find a way to turn it down or off. It's not an option, not even in "sounds" setting.

5. Also in sounds, I unclick tablet sounds and they are still there anyways. Its very annoying when typing on keypad.

All that said, it's true you do get what you pay for. Charger heating up is my biggest concern with this tablet and reason for return.
I would not recommend purchasing it, until the above "CONS" are fixed by manufacturer, especially the charger.
Hope this review helps you in your decision to buy or not :)

I was extremely excited and nervous waiting for my two tablets to show up.
On the one hand, plenty of good reviews swearing by how well they delivered; on the other, horrible anger at shoddy QA, build quality and customer service.
Very happy to report that I'm swearing by how well they delivered.

As long as you frame your expectations around the fact that these are ~$70 tablets, I think you should expect to be wildly impressed with what they're delivering.

Does it have a vibrant screen?  No.
Does it feel like one solid piece of aluminum in your hands?  No.
Can you become a professional photographer with the on board cameras?  Not any kind of professional photographer I've ever known.

But it's a $70 tablet people - if you're expecting high-end experience, it's foolish to think you'll get it for the lowest price going.

All I needed for my purposes was basic functionality.
The processor delivers a passable quad core experience.
The screen (with very deliberate design) will be readable from 25-50' away (I'll be displaying large numbers)
Networking seems reliable enough.

All of the tradeoffs I've come across so far have seemed legitimate (and expected) to reach it's price point.

I ordered this for my son's birthday and was extremely disappointed.  Do not buy this device if you value your personal information!  At face value everything looks great with this device, until you connect it your wifi and look through the settings.

The wifi in this device is completely useless and makes the device completely useless.  I am a security analyst and used to be a network engineer so I naturally started troubleshooting the issue.  I found that the wireless is disconnecting and reconnecting about every 1.5 seconds causing horrible lag and most apps to not work at all.  I even tweaked my home wifi settings to help and it slowed the reconnects to 1.7 seconds.  I finally gave up and started looking through other settings on the device.  I have two other Android device at home and have never had issues with wifi.

It says 8GB, but it is really only 5GB.  Between the "Internal Storage" and "Internal SD Card"  There is just over 5GB, which means that you only get about 3.5GB of usable space after the OS.

If those two aren't deal breakers then this will be.  The device is rooted.  You may be asking what does that mean.  It means that someone(likely the seller - TabletExpress) has loaded their own version of the Android OS on the device.  Doesn't sound to bad right? Wrong!  This allows them to put malware on the device that can collect information without you knowing!  Anything you type, load or access on the device can and will be collected and sent to them.  Including things like your bank account password or credit card information from orders you have placed.

I thought that this may have been a fluke since there were so many other good reviews, so I returned the first one I ordered and had them ship out another one.  It was the same thing!  I also tried calling their customer support number (during their listed business hours) and it rang three times and went to voicemail.  I tied this several times and never got through.

If you take away the wifi issues, lack of storage and the fact that it is rooted, the device actually performs pretty well for a budget tablet.  But these issues may it a "wouldn't touch it with a ten foot pole" for me.
Screen provides a clean picture and the sound quality is also good.

I bought this after reading the mostly positive reviews. I purchased this as a homeschooling aid for our family so that my children would be able to use education apps on it. I loved the price and the large screen.

I sent an email to the customer service of TabletExpress, heard no response and sent another email almost two weeks later and mentioned if I didn't hear anything I would be going to Amazon Customer service, amazingly enough I got a replay the next day.

I was very unimpressed with the unprofessional, condescending email I received. The person who wrote it (didn't sign their name) threw their coworkers under the bus because they hadn't been able to keep up the work while they were on vacation, and repeatedly used the phrase "Please make sure you're using the product correctly" which I was. They also included this line, which my husband and I laughed for days about: "Also if the app you run is big, it may overburden the ram and cause shutting off during operation." Then why in the world are you putting your name on this product and selling it?!? If you're telling me this product can't handle apps coming out nowdays, then how are you planning on creating a business with it? The tablet even crashed running Chrome, a program that comes installed on it!!

The only helpful thing in the email was they recommended a factory reset, which fixed the restarting problem for a few days. However it started up again, the same day I was planning on writing customer service (for the third time) I dropped the tablet, cracked it, and now it's no longer working correctly, I'm not sure if I could return or exchange it at this point, and honestly I'm not sure I'd want to.

To Summarize: I regret buying this and wish I'd saved my money for a better tablet. Disappointed in my interactions with the seller as well.

I am a student that purchased this tablet to help me with schoolwork. I intended to use this tablet mainly to view PDF's and PowerPoint presentations so that I can use my laptop's whole screen space to do the actual work. I also wanted to be able to use the device to read magazines on Zinio and watch videos on Netflix and Youtube.

PROS:
-Physical build quality is good for the price point. It doesn't feel like a terribly cheap device.
-Price is pretty low for a device with this screen size

CONS:
-I'm not sure if it's the processor or the lack of ram (only 512mb) but this device felt under-powered for my pretty basic needs. PDF's viewed OK, but PowerPoint presentations were definitely laggy and took a while to load. Youtube was unwatchable at 720p, but fine at 480p. Netflix played fine with no noticeable lag. Reading magazines via Zinio was difficult, and scrolling between pages / trying to zoom in on articles produced lots of lag issues.
-Screen has a narrow viewing angle
-Wireless connectivity was an issue. It would randomly drop connection and had overall poor reception even when close to my Wifi router. This was especially aggravating when trying to download larger apps (it took me 4 times to successfully download MS PowerPoint)

If you have very basic needs for this tablet it may work for you (basic web surfing, watching low resolution video, etc), but apparently my demands were a bit much for this device. The performance combined with the wifi issues make this product a return for me. I am in the process of buying another tablet (Dragon Touch M8) which promises an improved screen, somewhat improved processor, and double the ram for around $35 more than the A93.

--Note: A card with the tablet says that if you contact the company after doing a review they will send you a free protective case. I do review all I purchase anyway but also make note if anything like this. I also update my review based on if the company follows through with its promises or not. Star rating will not be improved, it is a four star tablet. I will decrease for deceptive business practices on the other hand. Will note here if I receive this case or not.

Current status: Not received

Update: Card says to contact review@tabletexpress.com for your free case. That company had me submit screen captures of orders and my contact information (makes me wonder why, was very careful not to give personal information as I suddenly felt uneasy with what they where asking me to do). They later said that I did not order from them but from a company called Warehouse Deals, Inc. that I now see listed as the seller on Amazon. Seems to be some kind of bait and switch. I also get an uneasy feeling about the sudden change in company name. Makes me wonder what is going on and if the tablet should be checked out for spy ware or other identity theft tid bits.

I have adjusted my star rating to reflect this experience and very uneasy feeling about the product. I think money can be spent safer with a more reputable business.

This, among the reasons I'm about to detail, were why I returned it the same day I received it. I mean, the entire device IS a screen. If the screen is bad of what use is the device?

When I received it the screen also had a piece of plastic or hair or something manufactured right into the screen itself. It was underneath the touchscreen on the lower right portion of the device. I picked at it. Looked at it as closely as I could. It was a piece of something that got under the screen as the device was being built. It would always be there. Always be a nuisance. I can't believe any kind of QA personnel didn't catch this.

The device is listed as an 8GB storage device. When I opened up the settings and looked at the available storage? 4GB. They sent the wrong device.

This tablet is a STEAL for $69! Before I received this tablet, within three days, I ordered and returned two different $69 tablets (including a NeuTab N9 Pro) with identical specs and they were both lemons. Finally, I picked a winner with this Dragon Touch A93 9" Quad Core. It outperforms the Kocaso M9200 that I was using for the last year (1 year ago, that sold for $149). This tablet runs multiple applications quickly and smoothly. For me, (maybe not for gamers) I've downloaded all the apps I need and still have several GBs of storage available. If I needed it, this tablet does allow for a Micro SD card, and those are totally inexpensive. Facebook, FB Messenger, GMail, Chrome, etc, all work perfectly. I do use Netflix frequently, and the picture is superior to other comparable tablets, as is the sound. With the expensive Kocaso, I had to take the tablet out of its case to hear Netflix. In contrast, this tablet's volume is PLENTY loud. Netflix and other videos can be heard easily, even when in a case. The power adapter is NOT an issue at all!! The connector is a bit unusual; however, if you push the cable in gently until it "clicks" into place, the connection becomes secure and works perfectly. The battery life is great - I don't have to recharge for days at a time. For games, I only play Words and QuizUp, and they work well, but I haven't attempted any "gaming". The manufacturer provides an email and phone number in case you need to contact them for any kind of support. I did a lot of research comparing tablets in this price range with comparable specs. If you want the best possible tablet for a price under $100 (let alone, under $70), this is the tablet to purchase.

The Dragon Touch tablet seemed like an amazing deal at the time, considering the physical size and specs.  HD video plays just fine on this device, despite the lack of RAM.  If you write a positive review about this tablet on Amazon.com you get a free tablet case in the mail from the maker, as well.  Shipping was fast, and the fake leather backing is a classy, user-friendly touch.

But the Dragon Touch's screen is excessively bright to the point of washing out color and contrast, bubbles under the screen were an issue on my new model, front and rear cameras are flip-phone quality, 512MB of RAM was constantly bottle-necked, and after 6 months to the tee (like several other reviewers have reported) my tablet would take 5 or more reboots to turn on.  WI-fi would then proceed to cut out every ten minutes.  Restoring factory settings, hard resets, swapping MicroSD cards, etc did nothing to bring this tablet back to life.  The nail in the coffin was during a corporate relocation, when the tablet was slightly bent in my travel-on luggage, and the screen cracked like I had hit it with a baseball bat; with the backlight stuck on until it died.

It is an inexpensive tablet, but it doesn't have enough RAM nor color/ contrast for gaming despite the size/ specs. The Wi-fi lacks range and isn't conducive for web browsing longer than ten minutes.  The build quality is not at a level where I would feel comfortable having a rough and tumble kid use it for games.  In the end, this tablet was a good learning experience for me, even though I was out $60.  I would prefer a smaller tablet with more RAM and better build quality any day of the week.

I read the reviews for this device and figured it was worth a try as my first Android tablet.

Well, It starts up fast. That's about the only positive thing I can say about this. The screen is so bad I actually thought I received a defective device.  At a regular viewing distance, you can practically see the pixel squares of the washed out display. As if that wasn't bad enough, any slight change of a straight-on viewing angle almost completely changes the onscreen color from slightly washed out to almost completely washed out and weird looking. I have no idea what all the "positive" reviews are about because this tablet is a truly a piece of crap.

Overall connectivity and usability weren't an issue.  Even though I am a regular Mac/Windows user, I had very few problems adapting to and navigating the Android OS.But web browsing was kinda slow. The other problems I had was not being able to add the AdBlock extension to the Chrome browser and not being able to play flash based online content, streaming videos etc. This was the reason I got the tablet in the first place. That was my fault for not doing enough research on the android OS. Anyway, There are apps like Puffin and Dolphin etc. that can run flash-based content for Android. Even though this was not something I had planned on doing I got the app anyway. The picture results were so unbelievably bad that it defies comprehension. That said, even with all those shortcomings I would have been satisfied if the screen was somewhat acceptable. I cannot stress how bad the screen of this tablet is. I had such high hopes for this product and have been incredibly disappointed.  We are a family of programmers, high school students and such.  In our household there are 8 other computers and all play nicely on the wireless network.  This tablet is turned on and it blocks ALL other traffic on the wireless network.  It is consuming ALL of the wireless resources and none of the other computers can break through it's lock on the wireless.  We tried setting up a separate wireless modem for just it and it still blocks ALL wireless traffic , irregardless of which modem it is connecting to,  it is not channel specific.  As I said, we are a house of techies.  Many hours have been spent with tools to measure packet speed, upload and download from other computers and such.  This machine doesn't even have to be downloading anything.  When we turn it on and it connects to the wireless it destroys the connection for everyone else.  I've never encountered a product that can take out 8 computers at once.  We have gone through many diagnostics, changed settings (both on tablet and modems) , etc. etc. etc.  It is not solvable.  I got this for my 12 year old son for Christmas.  What a disappointment.  He is only allowed to connect to the internet for small periods of time, with permission so he doesn't kill the rest of us, and then he has to get off.  For him it is a glorified book reader - not the tablet it was advertised to be.  I am absolutely disgusted with this product.
Not the best graphics but it does the job for my 9 year old.

This really is an exceptional purchase. I purchased this for my 9 year old and was a bit skeptical about the quality, but figured for the price it couldn't hurt to give it a chance. I was completely surprised! I will be ordering another for myself.

I really wanted to like this Android tablet.  Sadly, it was not up to acceptable quality standards.  First off, the manual enclosed was for a different model entirely.  If this is your first tablet or first time with KitKat, you may have difficulty figuring things out. Secondly, the screen came loose and nearly fell out completely on several occasions.  This seems to be a common complaint.  I suppose the buyer could glue it in better, but it should have been manufactured properly in the first place.  I did phone the number enclosed for help, but got a recording twice stating that they were experiencing high volumes of calls, and to try emailing them.  The customer service at Tablet Express did call back promptly, but I had already printed a return label to send back to Amazon.
Must say it has a nice screen resolution and quick processor for this price point.

I chose this tablet because the good reviews outweighed the bad.  Wrong choice.
l bought this tablet for my daughter for Chrismas this past year. It was a step up from the generic tablet that she got last year, which was far better than this junk.
At first it was ok.  I honestly wasn't expecting much for the low price. But after just a month, (unfortunately longer than the Amazon return time limit for defects) it just stopped working. It won't turn off unless the battery dies, and when it is on it just stays on the "dragon touch" screen never going to the android load screen. And it gets worse.....
The tablet that we got for her Christmas 2013 was still working just fine. It was a Nextbook,  a smaller tablet with a generic OS (not android). When we got the dragon touch tablet, my husband started using her old tablet and they would connect to play pocketcraft together. When the dragon touch stopped working they were connected and playing pocketcraft at the time. Within a few hours of the dragon touch dying, the Nextbook also went out, doing exactly the same thing that the dragon touch was doing, not powering off and staying on the main screen never loading the OS. I have been able to reinstall the firmware for the Nextbook and it is working fine again. The dragon touch is not recognizing the firmware downloads from the tablet express website.
I have made several attempts to contact tablet express by both email and phone and have never gotten a response.  It's already past Amazon's return time limit and I don't hold out any hope of ever getting a response from tablet express. Money down the drain and a very sad 7 year old.

4 stars for value - very affordable and runs better than I though it would with less than a gig of ram.

4 stars for features - the lack of third party apps running on this device is not only necessary because it probably couldn't handle the background processing, but it's really nice to not have to deal with them. Screenshot and screen recording features were great as I use this for watching webinars at times.

2 stars for display - at this price I obviously wasn't expecting much, but something is funny about the backlighting and the resolution as I feel I'm going cross-eyed looking at the screen. I got a second one just to make sure the first one wasn't faulty. If you're used to high resolution displays or have any kind of light sensitivity, this tablet with probably not work for you.

I bought this as a gift for a close friend who was new to tablets. It was a great gift and reasonably priced.  The item arrived on time from Tablet Express and worked right out of the box (although they immediately put it on the charger overnight).  The screen is bright and clear leading my friend to start watching movies and looking for games.

The one element that is missing is this tablet does not have a Bluetooth transmitter.  The confusion was mostly on my part as I thought it was built-in.  My friend bought a separate transmitter that plugs into the headphone jack.

All-in-all this was a great gift for an android novice. Great product from Tablet Express for those looking for their first tablet.

The model has a home button on the upper left side to return to the home screen.  This is also where the volume controls are.  The actual model didn't have a return button and the volume and power buttons were along the bottom.  User interface was very confusing.  I returned it the next day.

We just received our Dragon Touch A93 9" tablet from Amazon.  I own several tablets and this one is by far my favorite, it is fast, easy to use and the battery lasts... which is a great thing especially when my children are using it constantly.  I really like the fact that you can put an external memory card! That's a plus, not a lot of tablets have that capability, I also bought a Kindle Fire HD and it doesn't have a slot for a memory card.  Good product, I highly recommend it.

I recognize that you get what you pay for, but given the many positive reviews on Amazon, I expected more. I only used this for a few days before returning it, but found it a frustrating experience.

1. The processor is slow. Opening PDF documents or new apps took ~10 seconds
2. The icons for new apps were auto-saving to weird locations (e.g., underneath the Google toolbar). This might be fixable, but it was frustrating, and a poor out-of-the box experience.
3. The size is nice, but the feel is cheap. This is expected for this price, but it's nonetheless true.
I received my tablet in just a couple of days..free shipping was great. Product is even better than I expected. Feels sturdy. Colors are bright and features are perfect for my needs. Love it.

I believe that every product should be based on a comparison against its competitors with overall product quality, hardware, and price being the 3 variables in the equations.  That being said after much consideration this product warrants a 4 out of 5. Quality is a 3. Hardware is a 4. Price a 5.  I have purchased 2 in 2 months. NOTE: You can receive a free case by writing a review. Instructions for redemption inside box.
Fantastic for the price! Great Seller!

I love my new DragonTouch A93 tablet.  I've been testing out for a day and a half, and have had no problems with it.  The onscreen keyboard works way better than my smartphone's one does.  It plays both of the games I like (Clash of Clans & Boom Beach) without any problems.  YouTube videos (even the HD ones) play flawlessly.  I've also watched two movies and two TV episodes in HD without any problems.  I do recommend that you charge the battery for a full 10 hours before using it for the first time.  Like other people here have said in their reviews of the A93, it'll help extend your battery life by a couple of hours.  Also like other people have mentioned, the speaker and the front and rear cameras aren't that great.  I'm fine with that since I always use headphones, and I only use the cameras for Skype.  But, for other people, they might be an issue.  Also, it does not have Bluetooth capability.  Again, not an issue for me.  But, others might not like that.  Overall, though, the DragonTouch A93 is a great entry-level tablet with many cool features.  If you want a new tablet, but, like me, you're on a budget, the A93 is a great option!

Not the smoothest running piece of machinery, but gets the job done for a low price. The only reason I bought it, is so that I don't need to worry about breaking my laptop in my backpack when I'm skating around campus.

I may upgrade this to a 5 after I spend some time with it, or  lower it. First impression, a real value for price paid. I have a 2nd gen Nexus 7 (Still have a first) and I got this for my wife to decide if she's interested in moving from her IOS to Android. The upside is we would be on the same platform. There some obvious reasons this is a $65 tablet. The plastic casing is very "plastic" and the screen is good but not HD by anymeans , although I was surprised at how well  You Tube displayed viewing the Dragon Touch instructional video. It synced up to my google account perfectly and the touch screen was very responsive to my touch. Speed is not blazing but adequate. My concerns so far is the wall charger. Its an old style round insert pin. It works but I have no idea where to find the car charger. Time will tell the final story but I did get this because of the many favorable reviews it recieved. Two features I wish my Nexus 7 had was a USB port and an SD card slot. I purchased and mounted a 32gb San disk as soon as I got this tablet signed up and synced up. I have little doubt after  using this and getting comfortable with Android my wife will want to upgrade to a Galaxy 10 . When that happens this unit will be the one I take camping or use as my Google Play audio library plugged directly into my amp (it doesn't have blue tooth, no biggie. So in conclusion, at this point, don't be afraid to spend a pittance on this tablet and get a really functional 9" tablet, you might be as surprised as I am at the moment.
Very happy!! Easy to type on even without keyboard.  IG keys mame it easy. Still trying to figure out color but great so far!

This is an addendum to my original review below.
I dropped one star because, while the tablet is everything I (and others) have said, the poor fitting power supply "did" fail after only a few months of very light use!
So after spending more money "and" more time & energy on having to buy a new power supply for it, the price of this tablet went up for me - and my review stars went down accordingly.
On a positive note, the new power supply not only has the correct size insert at the tablet end, but it has a usb connection at the wall wart end, so essentially, a dual purpose charger!

This is a good basic tablet for the money. It performs everything I need it to do quite well.
As others have noted, it's biggest issue is the poor camera quality (think cell phone pics from 1990s), but one can't really complain at these prices!
The only other issue with this tablet is that the power supply plug end that goes into the tablet is too long, so that can be a fragile spot while charging.
I would definitely recommend this tablet for those that want a great deal on an entry level tablet.

Caveat: I purchased this tablet to be a test device for Android development work, not as my daily-use tablet, so my rating is from that perspective. From a general-use standpoint, the screen is a bit washed out (anything on a light background is the worst) and the DPI is clearly sub-par. However, considering the price, I'm not counting that against it. Just don't expect an iPad or higher-end Android display here.

The major issue (from a developer perspective) I ran into was that ADB would not recognize the tablet. After a couple hours of searching forums and trial and error, I found that I could use the Samsung ADB driver that I had installed for an older Fascinate phone I have, and adb works fine now. But they really should document that on their website; there is no documentation for the A93 anywhere, other than the sales sheet.

The other issue I have is the power cable -- it is a poor design in my opinion. The connector only goes halfway into the tablet, and there is no tactile feedback for when the connector is seated. It is very easy to jar loose as well. I connected it to power, set the tablet down, and came back later only to find it hadn't charged at all due to the cable wiggling enough to disconnect it, even though it appeared to be connected.

As a development/test device, it does what I want it to do. I took off a star due to the adb difficulties, poor power connector and lack of website documentation. If this were my day-to-day tablet, I would want a higher quality (i.e. more expensive) display, but it is perfectly suitable for my purposes.

The screen is just too small for anything else with my old eyes. But I'm planning on taking a couple of road trips this spring and summer, and wanted to keep in touch with kids/grandkids without taking a laptop. Thus I have entered the tablet age. I didn't want to get an expensive "do everything including your laundry" model - it would just be over kill for me. I just wanted something to keep in touch with everybody, play my games, and read my books. This size (9") is perfect for this. I did install a 32g sd card so I know I have room for a movie or two and any tunes I want to load. Update: 8-20-2016 Dropped from 4 stars to 2 stars. Last years trips were put on hold and this was put away. Finally brought it out a couple of months ago to get it ready of new vacation plans. Tried to load a couple of Facebook games, but the tablet kept acting like it was timing out- game would start to load, after a few seconds the screen would go black, and then back to the home page. Decided to do a "factory reset" and start fresh. Nope, same thing happened. Sometimes I would get as far as the game loading but before I could even play it the screen would go black again and back to the home page. This happened with DoubleDown Casino, Spin it Rich Slots, Candy Crush Soda, Hit it Rich. Slots, Slotomania, Candy Crush Jelly, Big Fish Casino, and Caesars Slots. Email customer support, got a note back saying to do a factory reset (already done twice) and to include the tablets serial number with correspondence. Since I registered my table right after I got it, they have all my info. I just wanted to know if I was doing something wrong or if there was some setting I needed to change, or what. I'm leaving it at 2 stars instead of just 1 since I can still play a few off-line games, listen to music, and use it as an e-reader. I really wanted to use this more because of the screen size but that's not gonna happen. I also have a Fire 7 Fire Tablet, 7" Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers, Black. It will play all the above mentioned games and more...and that will be my go-to tablet.

I wanted a 8-9" tablet and being on a tight budget at the moment I didn't want to shell out another couple hundred dollars or more so I thought I'd go for this budget tablet based on the positive reviews.  First, let me say, the company offers you a free case if you give a 5-star review.  Sort of puts all these 5-star reviews into question knowing that.  They also offer to resolve any issues you have, but I have not had need to contact the company.  On the whole this tablet seems satisfactory for my needs as a budget tablet.  The only question I'm still working out is that it seems to have a harder time locking onto the wifi than any of my other devices ever have.  In some places this isn't a problem, but in other places it may mean I can't get wifi on this device while my other devices work.  I've been playing videos, reading kindle app, facebooking, and playing a lot of Dragon Storm (too much) and the graphics seem perfectly adequate for that to me, while understanding that if primo quality graphics are important to you this is probably not the tablet for you.  I just hope, when I can afford to rejoin the gym, it will hold the wifi signal long enough to play netflix while I'm on the cardio equipment, because that is one of the main things I specifically need these tablets for.  I will try to remember to come back and let you know.
UPDATE:  It's been a couple years.  It seems to work fine enough at the gym to keep connected to wifi enough to watch netflix, so that's great.  Only problem I have with it really is that the headphone jack seems to be imperfect so when I stick the headphone jack in I have to find a "sweet spot" to get the headphones to work.

Excellent value that appears well made with good tablet performance. We have not had it long enough to rate durability but appears surprisingly solid. Two minor criticisms: the launcher that came with it was not optimal; it placed app icons over the Google search bar. That was fixed by replacing with a better launcher available from the Google app store (Nova launcher), an easy and effective fix. The charger uses a non-USB style connector to a dedicated DC port. But it appears to charge through the USB port also, but don't know if that is equivalent to the dedicated DC port. You can get replacement chargers by searching Amazon, so not a major issue. I would recommend this as a very cost effective way to get a decent 9 inch Android tablet for about $70. I have seen what appears to be an identical tablet sold under the RCA name in a major retail store and it was priced at $139.

*sigh* well....the product arrived in one piece in a pretty timely manner ( wish i still had prime, to have received it in two days ).

this is literally my first day with the tab, but in order to get my complimentary case, im going to write this right away.  so far...the screen isn't bad. it's not good, but it's not bad either :-P  the viewing angles are poor, as far as photos are concerned, but looking at everything straight on, or text at an angle, it's more than adequate. if you want super amoled, hd, vibrant colors, retina displays, then it's time to fork out more money.

the wifi seems to work fine; i watched a youtube video for a few minutes with no problem, and obviously it's not the sharpest quality, but watchable.

the speaker's so so, but it transmits sound, and i plan to install this in my truck and push sound to the system through the auxiliary, so on board projection is meaningless.  again, for the money, this is more than worth it { especially with 4.4 kitkat, and i just downloaded nova launcher from the play store )....let me plug in my headphones and see if there's a lack of quality there.... oi vay...well, compared to my note 4, it sounds kind of bad, but hopefully it'll improve at least a little bit after upgrading the version of google music on board.  or maybe ill find an eq app to fix it up if that doesn't work.***

one problem i just ran into that also has me a bit concerned: i went to transfer files from both my galaxy and my computer to the dragon. at first, all was fine ( transferring from galaxy to dragon through the pc was alright, but when i transferred from the pc to the dragon, oh my, was it ever fast--even faster than transferring files from the pc to the galaxy, interestingly enough ), but then i began to encounter a repeated error informing me of something like "parameters incorrect"? i briefly googled it and found the basis of it could me a regional incompatibility....so im just hoping that when i get a memory card, i'll have better luck copying to that rather than the dragon memory....60% of my music transferred successfully ( and that filled most of the tab memory anyway ), so i'm satisfied with that for now...

i noticed something odd....there's either a preinstalled screen protector on the device, or some kind of strange plastic permanent layer on the screen...being that it isn't scratched up, im not going to pay it any mind, and i'm certainly not going to try to remove it just yet.  if it's a protector, then score for the manufacturers for saving buyers the trouble.  other than that, and the "friction of newness" when first engaging the touch surface, the dragon navigates rather smoothly, both physically and functionally.

i'm trying to be as candid as possible to help potential buyers make as informed a decision as possible, and i know 3 stars doesn't seem all that great, but all things considered, the tablet was more than i expected it to be, and certainly worth the money, for the size and function.

Peace.

***update: ahh, well, even with various audio enhancing apps, the sound wasn't quite up to par with what i've come to expect from my truck's little system.  it was just too drastic a change, and the app that came closest to making it tolerable seems to have been buggy and inconsistent, so unfortunately i'm returning this and looking for options on craigslist.  it's a shame, if only they had put better audio into the unit, everything else would have been fine.  but really, if you're not an "audiophile" ( or picky :-P ) of any variation, this is still a good little tablet for the money.

and now that i think about it...i may play with the eq apps some more *sigh* i hate giving up; i'm way too loyal a person...we'll see what happens...

Outstanding performance for a Tablet at this price.  I have owned sever different tablets and this one is a Great Deal for the Price.  I could not believe the performance and the speed is also there,  I would recommend this Tablet to all my friends it is a keeper.
a horrible screen- not crisp, dim, almost sand like surface.  Hurts eyes and fingers.

Great value for the price. Was able to use it right away, did not have to wait to charge it. Easy to navigate. The only thing I don't like is that adjusting the brightness on the device does not adjust the brightness of Google chrome. I have already set it to the lowest brightness in the settings, which adjusts the navigation screen, but not the browser. It's a bit too bright for me when I go online, but I am slowly getting used to it.
Arrived quickly. Bought this for my mom and she is learning how to work it slowly but she enjoys it and is getting there for someone who has never had a tablet before. You can't beat the price.

I bought two of these tablets just before Christmas.  Both arrived with the packaging air pillows broken so the tablets in my opinion were not protected since they are electronic devices.  They were sliding all around the shipping box so that does concern me and how it might affect their longevity and if it will affect the performance.  I was not happy seeing that when I opened the boxes.  The other thing I am a little disappointed in is the battery charger plug does not fit all the way seated into the device.  When plugged into the device a small section remains outside of the plug and I was afraid to try and push it all the way in.  For me the wifi is a little weak in some of my rooms but that may be due to our router. I wish it had been stated in the product write up that this tablet DOES include a screen protector.  Not knowing that in advance I purchased two different versions on Amazon which in actuality I did not need.  One did not fit the screen size anyway so that was a waste. The 3 pack for now I will just hold onto for when I am ready to replace the one the tablet came with.  That was a nice surprise I must say as putting on protectors can be so frustrating, time consuming and expensive. On the positive side for the money you can't go wrong with this tablet.  I have had the Android OS in my expensive smart phones and also on  my Nexus 7.  This tablet works pretty darn good for the most part and I like the size for typing on the keyboard vs both my phone and Nexus 7.  For fun I also ordered the matching keyboard folio and again for the price, I like it.  It's nice to have a stand to prop the tablet up and the keys work good.  Be sure to carefully take the tiny piece of plastic that covers the camera lens on the BACKSIDE of the tablet.  I didn't notice that the first few days but when I looked closely I could see it had a very THIN piece of protective plastic.  That will improve the quality and the complaints about the photos being grainy.  It's still won't be perfect but certainly acceptable.  I am overall very happy with this tablet that I have been using for a few weeks now. I am having lots of fun exploring all the things it really can do.  Don't be afraid to experiment and open settings and change them.  This is an inexpensive powerhouse of options with some exploring.  I did buy a 32 GB SD with the idea I would get the most out of the tablet.  The 4 stars is only due to the few negative issues listed in the intro of the review.

Great price for a good sized screen.  we struggled with getting the 7" or the 10.1" and think we made the right choice.  This is a big screen, but not oversized.  Perfect for our use.
Shipped well and everything is working perfect right out of the package.  The quality of the camera is pretty horrible, grainy, etc., but what we expected based upon the other reviews.

I'm surprised by how much I love this tablet. It's very easy to use and has just about every feature you would expect from a big brand name  Android tablet. The only downside I could determine is that the camera is not great and there's not a lot of storage space, but fortunately  it's expandable and so easily remedied.

Also, my husband has a Samsung Galaxy tablet and we noticed that the Dragon Touch is much faster than his Samsung, which was a very pleasant surprise for me.

If your looking for a good quality tablet for general use and don't want to pay a lot of money, I would definitely try this one.
Really nice and light weight with good graphics. Easy to set up and read.

This thing works really well, it's fast and responsive and screen size is just right. No problem getting it up and running.
I needed a tablet that would allow me to view streaming videos from Netflix and other service, of course Amazon had different plan.
So I'll keep adding Apps and enjoy my Dragon Touch tablet.
No complaints! Really a great tablet especially for the price. Works great for our teenager.
As someone who is not very tech savvy and who has not used a tablet before I am finding the Dragon Tough to be quite easy (and fun) to use. It is stylish and the price was right!

Received in only 2 days! Ordered for my husband who needed a larger screen than his phone for checking his email, playing games, etc. Set-up was easy and he is already enjoying his new "toy"!  Would definitely recommend this product! Very satisfied!
Purchased  this tablet for my husband.  The screen size & resolution are fantastic!  The apps are incredibly user friendly.  Perfect technology for my husband.

very fast tablet, super cost effective, great sound quality, love the product

seemed to work good, but the screen was chipped. i would of kept it but it was a gift for my mom.
Decent tablet, but , the WiFi range is not good , and there are blue lines on screen sometimes .

I'm very pleased with this tablet. It is responsive, very little lag and lets me read and browse the internet from my bed instead of having to be up at the computer! I'm using it primarily as an ereader, so I am not using it for gaming or anything like that. Youtube videos are crisp, and I'd presume that movies would play well on it.

All in all, it's a great budget tablet. Vibrant, large screen, very little bloatware right out of the box! If you are expecting an i-pad quality device at this price point, you'd be sadly mistaken, but if you have kids or just want a nice travel tablet or an e-reader with "extra" features for the same price as some black and white reader models, you'll be pleased.

I also purchased a 32 GB Micro SD card to go with this as the internal memory does leave something to be desired, but if you are serious about books/music/pictures/etc you'll have already thought about that before and will already own one or consider picking one up as they are very affordable.

Good stuff though so I highly reccomend giving this one a go if you are looking for an inexpensive option!
My mother  n  law is enjoying her new tablet. It's just what she needed, fast and easy to use.

It's quick, (mostly) easy for a first time tablet user, AND it looks really cool ;).
Seriously- this is one of the best tech purchases I've ever made & I'm exceedingly happy with my new tablet. And the battery outlasted a very smart, but bored, 8 year old!

I got the dragon toucha93 9",only had it for a few hours and so far happy with it as I am not good with computers,but this was very easy to connect to the internet. It has a nice screen and easy to use. I think I'm gonna like it!

The shipping was very fast.  I have a laptop computer that I use and like perfectly fine, so I wanted an inexpensive starter unit just to see if I would even like or use a tablet that much.  The setup was fine, WIFI set up quickly, downloading apps is very quick, and the screen and sound seems to be quite good.  Apps seem to respond about as quickly as my cell phone, and browsing, scrolling, etc. seem very good.  The only concern I have right now is that the battery seems to drain extremely fast.  I picked it up fully charged this morning, did just a few things from 9:30 am to 10:00 am, then was occupied with other things until about 5:00 pm, and when I picked it back up only 7 hours later, the battery was all the way down to 40% just sitting dark.  I currently have an email into the company to see if they think the unit is defective or if there is some settings I may need to tweak.

**UPDATE** 1/13/15
After getting into more of a regular use schedule after the holidays, the battery has "learned" and is now doing very well, it is not an issue.  I plug it in overnight just like my cell phone, and even after a fair amount of use through the day it only goes down to around 50% or more, and it does NOT drain quickly anymore.  However, now having more use under my belt, I do have to say that the tablet isn't especially speedy, but again, I think it is fine for a general use, starter tablet, and I enjoy using it.

Bought this as a second tablet for the family.  So far it's been easy to set up (helps if you've set up wi-fi and email accounts before as there wasn't a step by step tutorial included) and has everything you need in a tablet.  Nice display, good sound.  Price was so reasonable you really can't go wrong!
Decent tablet for the price. At this price point, you know what you're getting, so don't expect an iPad.  Feels substantial, seems responsive and quick, and is a good size.

This product is exactly what I was looking for.  A budget tablet to suit my casual needs.  With a price of $72.99 (got it on sale), the specs were pretty good.

It's not top of the line, but neither is the cost.  For a person looking for a decent tablet with a low cost, you will not be disappointed.  I was a little nervous since the producer is not a very well known one, but I'm glad I took that risk.

Nice screen size, good processing rate.  Battery life is ok.  I've used it for a few hours actively, and had it sleeping for a couple days, and it used half the battery.  It could use a little more RAM and storage space, but again, it's a matter of low cost on those.

I mainly use it for games, browsing Facebook and the internet, and as a calendar.  Everything runs very well.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet for under $100.
Was amazed of how nice this tablet is very clear and runs fast

I had bought this tablet for my boyfriend as a Christmas gift and he loves it. I got here just in time and the set up instructions were pretty simple. I also love how the back feels like leather compared to most tablets.

I bought this tablet for my mother to use as an affordable e-reader to replace her Kindle when it died.  It does that quite well.  . My only criticism is the instructions that come with it are generic and seem to be used for a variety of models.  It took me (and I am pretty computer literate) about 30 minutes to figure out how to access the "back" button to get out of one screen and return to the former.  For those of you reading this and having the same issue, you need to tap on the bottom of the screen and that option will appear, unlike a button on the top as the instruction manual suggests.

This review is for the Dragon Touch A93 9" quad Core Google Android 4.4 KitKat Tablet PC which I purchased from Tablet Express.  The product was very promptly shipped and arrived in good order.  It was well packaged.  However, when we unpacked both of the tablets and peeled back protective plastic sheet there were air bubbles trapped under the display.  In the first table these were localized to the edges.  The second tablet had the same problem but also had spots where dust or some material was trapped under the display, creating perfect 3-4mm circles.  At first we thought these might be part of the laptop, but they clearly were not as the camera was clearly visible and there was nothing else they could be based on the instructions.  We didn't power up the first one but we did power up the second one, thinking we might keep it anyway since it was quit affordable.  It booted up fine and looked to be a pretty standard Android tablet however after a few minutes we decided we would rather spend a little more and get a better quality device.  So we are shopping for another purchase.  The vendor clearly cares about their product and there were instructions in the package asking we consider calling the vendor to resolve any problem we may have.  However, we opted to look for for something else and just returned it through Amazon.  I gave this a one-star rating because this is a obvious quality control problem that should not have escaped the manufacturer and for which there is really no excuse.
It's a very good product for the price you pay. Smooth, fast, and easy to maneuver on this tablet. I definitely recommend it.
Awesome tablet for a awesome Price indeed
Best little tablet out their hands down would recommend it too many very powerful little tablet. looks like I spent over $300 wow very happy
This is my first tablet and has been a great experience. Excellent value!

I really wanted to love this tablet because the price was so good. And I overlooked some tiny scratches on the screen, and a problem with the sound card. Without headphones, the sound is pretty good. You could actually listen to something, as long as there was no background noise. But with two different headphones and or computer speakers, you could hardly hear anything. Even that, I was going to overlook, because the picture and battery life was very good and it booted so fast.

But one of the things that I do most on tablets is voice search. I also dictate my emails. In fact, I'm dictating this right now on another cheap tablet. but the voice search was so ineffective as to be comical. It's also quite slow, but of course, a half a gigabyte of RAM is not much. But you don't expect too much I'm such an inexpensive tablet. I gave up, I sent it back, and I finally ordered a little better quality - a Samsung tablet.

EDIT: So I turned the headphone jack in its socket many times, and finally the sound came up and it has stayed up for several days. Then I installed and configured Google Plus. And now I use that for voice search, and it works. (So it was not a bad mike.)

There was a glitch with the battery meter, but I just kept it going, and eventually, the battery level went down, and now it's working again.

I gave it one more star and decided to keep it for work and the bath tub.  The refurb Samsung is awesome, but I'm scared to use it. :-/
Good value tablet!  Thank you!

I intitually bought this for my daughter.  The first thing that I noticed right away was the quality of the picture. The second thing I noticed was the sound didn't work, even after I put the volume all the way up. I put in headphones and it still didn't work. The button was broken. Of course, I called Amazon for a replace which I had to reorder all again before Amazon could reimburse me. This was a Christmas gift and I was stuck reordering. I spoke with Amazon and ended up going with a different tablet which they did reimburse me half the price of the new tablet. While the price is unbeatable, the reviews seem almost stretched. I always go with the reviews first but this one is VERY misleading. I gave it one star for the price and one star for its overall usefullness. After an extensive search for an inexpensive tablet I purchased 4 of these for various family members, they weren't for anything special just a tablet to get on the internet and play games with.  Most of the reviews were positive, and it seemed perfect for what it would be used for.  Unfortunately these tablets didn't even come close to what the reviews said.  The internet was ridiculously slow, over 5 minutes to open Google search page.  We thought that maybe there were to many devices trying to connect to the internet so we turned off everyones wireless except 1 tablet and it was no different.  There was a "fast" internet setting but I didn't notice a difference.  The controls were cumbersome, where my Samsung phone has 3 buttons on the phone that control most of the features the tablet had like 5 buttons on the interface and I never got used to them.  The reviews said the camera was bad and it was, looked worse than my flip phone from 2005.  Perhaps with more practice the buttons would become second nature, but after waiting all night to search something on Google all tablets were shipped back the next day.
Loved this tablet. Only problem is it isn't 1gb of RAM which is needed for some games. Very fast, decent display, sturdy, not flimsy.

However, the battery seemed to delete time rather quickly so I plugged it in again for additional charging. This time the tablet did not power up.

Contacting Tablet Express, there seemed to be a problem and I was offered an exchange. I declined and returned it for refund.
I like the size of the screen and the sleek, flat look. The processing speed is fast and finishes quickly. There are a wide range of apps. It is has a great price. My 10 year old loves it.

If you understand that this is an entry level tablet, you will not be disappointed. I purchased for my young son after my original edition kindle started glitching. First impressions are as follows: the camera is mediocre, not really good quality.  the wifi is slow with downloads in comparison to other devices. touchscreen is reactive so no problems there. set up is android so no need to learn a new os.
The thing that is troublesome to me however is the complete misrepresentation of memory. The storage on this device is 1.97 GB and 2.68 GB total stock respectively...nowhere near the 8GB as described. Not sure why they do this, it's easy to see the storage space in settings. At least its expandable via micro SD. At mid $70 range, it is what it is....
This was a perfect gift for my 10 year old son! The price point was right and it arrived quickly!

Great tablet.  Not glitchy like some off brands.  Fully functional with play store.  Quad core that handles movies and games smoothly, audio is good and loud enough, expandable memory with an sd card.  I bought on to replace a nabs tablet for kids which was awful.  This one was so much better I bought two more one to replace a galaxy tablet and another to replace an old kindle (sorry Amazon). It also has a larger screen than comparable tablets (which are usually 7-8 inches). The larger screen was a plus for watching videos and playing games.  Three tablets, three happy kids and one happy aunt. Great price too... I couldn't find any highly rated tablets at this price point, they were all much more. Can't wait to see the updated and new products coming under the dragon name... I'm very impressed!

Awesome tablet! Price was great too!!  Would definitely purchase again.
The tablet is awesome it has lots of room to download games and apps.

Great tab for the price. Super fast and plays games well. A few cons, the screen could be a bit brighter and the touch screen is a bit figidity at times, also the power supply input is in an odd spot and finally, no mini HDMI output.
the Dragon touch a93 with KitKat is nice entry level tablet.the device is good for websurfing and email. The battery life is good.

It seems to be a good product. Be sure to charge for ten hours before using to help ensure good battery life. It connected to the home network just fine and I was poking away in just  few minutes. Now for the caution. It says 8 G memory, well I only see about 6 and a lot of that is used by the stuff on the device. The program I wanted to load takes 3.8 G to install and it will not load as it cant find enough memory. There appears to be a solution- buy a good sized micro sd card when you order this. I have one on the way to see if this will allow me to finish the install. It might be worth the vendors time to list the 8 G and then how much is useable.
UPDATE:  the 16G sd card did not help the tablet to load the program, it still only sees its memory and doesn't access the mounted sd memory.
So be careful of the memory you need. I think its overall all good product just did not meet my need.

JUNK!  DO NOT BUY!  I purchased two of these tablets as Christmas for family members.  I originally left a good review because I wanted to receive the free case.  After having the tablets for 30 days the volume went out on one if the tablets.  After calling several times without a response someone finally called me back and a return was set up.  We went without the tablet for 2 weeks and then we finally received a new one.  We had the new tablet and within one week the screen cracked.  I called the company and they said that a cracked screen does not fall under the warranty and there was nothing they can do.  The screen does not work at all.  They told me there is one place on ebay to order a screen from.  The screen is 29.99 and is on order but not available for shipping for 6-8 weeks.  I was very frustrated.  2 more weeks have gone by and now the other tablet screen is cracked.  These tablets are serious junk!!! I wasted $150.

I really like the product. Purchased for my mother to use on her travels.  Like the dual cameras and the micro SD slot so that she will not run out of room.  Very easy to navigate, taught her in less than 10 minutes. Like the keyboard. At first, I though it was a little big. Hard to read the screen and what I was typing. After watching Mom I realized that the keyboard was a good size for her. I think she is going to enjoy the tablet very much. Make sure to follow start up instructions and get that initial full charge on the battery.

The tablet arrived on time and in perfect condition. It's quick and responsive and runs all of my most important apps. I'm joining the wire cutting craze and cancelling cable. This tablet is a central piece of my new over the air and Internet streaming life style. It feels perfect for the job. The price is right. The 9 inch display is bright and clear. And the touch interface is responsive.

My one and only concern is that WiFi on this device is pretty weak. I get a touch nervous seeing the signal strength meter vary all over the map over time while the other devices in my home are rock steady all of the time. At this time I am only giving this tablet an "it's ok" rating as it was purchased just this Christmas as a gift.  I'll change the rating appropriately as warranted should it's performance exceed this rating or it fails to meet this current rating.

Update (1/12/2015): My final rating is two (2) stars.

While I'm writing this I will be purchasing a "Fire HD" tablet to replace this one.  The Dragon Touch does work but it has many, many flaws and performance issues. One major issue is that the screen colors seems to fade at any given time (the colorization of the display fades even with anti glare screen protection or different lighting) the display also seems to lack the vibrant colors even with it settings adjusted for the best display.  Its response time (especially on-line and initial game loading) is very laggy even when the device is in the same room as the wireless router.  My kids all have a brand name 7 tablet and I have a brand name transformer tablet, all of us loaded the exact same pages, in the same room, at the same time and individually.  The 'sevens' averaged 4 - 5 seconds per page, transformer avg. 6 - 7 seconds, and the Dragons' best time was almost a minute and several (4) timed out page loads.  May I also point out that all were using the native browser included with the tablets.  The Dragon tablet also has a tendency to simply shut-down, for no reason that I could discover. And it would need to be physically turned back on again.  I did notice that it seemed to shut-down when playing a game or loading a graphically intense website, either way it was more than I cared to worry about since I already decided to return it. Dragon boasts a 'Quad Core' but it is the slowest Quad Core I have ever used.
My recommendation, buy it for your kids or as a starter tablet for someone, they'll learn a lot about how to be patient and learn how to make changes to the settings and make necessary adjustments within the tablet. In the end, they become a little more tech savvy. They also learn to solve problems without assistance; and you will have received and produced more from your $80 purchase (lets call it an "investment") than you could have ever have received from this tablet alone. When you finally feel they're ready for a tablet of better quality, you can be certain they will more than appreciate the the down-time.
