For a tablet in this price range this Dragon Touch is a very good value. It's fast, has a nice clear 1024 x 600 resolution screen display and is a nice size. It connected right away to my home Wi-Fi network after entering the security code and I went right to the Google Play Store, logged in to my Google account and downloaded some of my favorite apps and simple games, like card games and such. (Keep in mind that memory and processor intensive games won't run well or may crash on a tablet like this, in this price range. Many of the games out there these days are pretty sophisticated.) With the quad core, the download and installation went fast. I like the Android 4.4 (Kit Kat) because the interface is very customizable. I spent the next half hour or so downloading some new wallpapers and arranging everything the way I like. I love the ease of dragging things around on the screen and finding a clock that I like. There are so many possibilities. Then I got the Kindle reading app and checked out this tablet for reading. The actual Kindle tablet is still the best for books but It's a lot more expensive. This tablet does a perfectly good job and is easy on the eyes as well as the pocketbook. The capacitive, multi-touch technology makes the screen sensitive to the touch. Pinching and expanding gestures are very responsive and fast. I am adding a video so you can get an idea of what the tablet looks like. Please keep in mind that by compressing the video in order to uplpad it here, it loses a little and actually looks nicer when you have it in front of you. A sample was provided for testing and review.
This is a really good buy. Only drawback is the camera. But I Love it!!

First I will say, I had a Dragon Touch K7 and thought for the money it was a great value for a budget level tablet. My wife liked it too and consequently, I lost that tablet to her. So when I was offered a discount for my next purchase, I got this A93 9 inch tablet for me. I have had no issues with TE customer service, all my orders from TE have arrived quickly receiving the order within a couple days after placing the ordering. Customer service was also quick and responsive via email with my questions as well. Inside the box with the tablet are the instructions, an AC adaptor, and a mini USB to USB cable. The specs of the tablet includes the latest android 4.4.2, quad-core CPU (1.2 ghz), 9 inch touch screen 1024x600, 8 gb storage, 512 mb ram, 2.0mp front and rear camera and wireless n. TE warrants this for 1 year warranty. This tablet, like most of TE tablets, is a budget level tablet that although the specs aren't as high end as what you would see on the latest Nexus or I-pad but this is a pretty decent budget level tablet at a pretty good price at 75 dollars. For basic web surfing, checking email and playing some games this tablet will do the job just fine. You don't have the speed or screen resolution of the more expensive tablets nor is the camera resolution as high as the more expensive tablets either but you are getting quite a bit for your money. The tablet maybe isn't as thin as the newer and more expensive tablets but isn't as thick as you would expect and isn't heavy (weighs about 1 pound). The battery life is decent. Like all the TE tablets I have, you do have to charge it for 10 hours the first day and second day and does take some time to recharge fully after that. Battery life lasted all day long when I was setting this up, downloading my apps that I want (considering I lost my tablet to the wife where I had already done that), and surfing the net. The battery life in standby mode has lasted several days without a charge. For a budget tablet that is pretty good. Initial setup was fairly easy and is similar to most android based devices. I had no issues with setting up the wireless or anything like that but like most TE budget tablets, this does not have Bluetooth ability. I do wish that the Bluetooth feature was included, but again this is a budget level tablet. I also made a few changes with some of the settings to my liking (I disable Mobogenie app store) but there didn't seem to be as much bloat ware on this tablet like the K7 had. For me, although not a big deal, I do wish I could have uninstalled Mobigenie or other apps that aren't critical to the operating system. Unfortunately like most android devices you are stuck with some type of bloat ware whether it is a name brand device or not. I added an 8 Gig SD card in spare card slot on the tablet; however you can add larger SD cards. For most of TE tablets, I highly recommend adding at least an 8 gig card or you will find you have limited space for adding your apps, games, music or video. Watching videos worked fine and the screen was surprisingly bright and clear and a decent (although not true HD) resolution. The sound I felt was better than the K7 I have but don't expect Bose quality sound as again this is a budget level tablet but I am fine with that. The cameras both take decent snapshots and although not as high megapixels as more expensive tablets. The one weird thing is I found two photos one the tablet of what appeared to be accidently taken at the TE offices. I actually accidently took pictures myself as it has the option to unlock either directly to the camera or the tablet and before I figured that out, I had snapped some pictures of the floor. So I assume this is how the 2 photos got on there, so whoever you are you have lovely head of hair by the way and a nice shoe. ;-) Once I figured out not to be so quick on the unlock swipe, I have not taken any more accidental photos. For a budget level tablet this works very well with all of the apps, music, video, net surfing and games (although basic ones but I don't play too many tablet games anyways) that I have tried to do with it. It has been fairly speedy and will be great basic tablet for me to use on trips. For a budget tablet it does everything (except Bluetooth) I have tried, so I am happy with it. 4 and a half stars With this tablet, I purchased this case. TabSuit 9'' Tablet Folio Keyboard Case with Stand Universal PU Leather for Dragon Touch N90 / Neutab N9/N9 Pro/ Astro Queo A912 Tablet and more 9'' Tablets I received a discounted product (not free) and I do not promise a good rating or review in return, nor am I affiliated with this company or compensated in any way.
